conversations.content: Hellooooo, darling Euden! I trust you're keeping yourself out of trouble. Your oh-so-magnanimous sister brings you good tidings.
My glorious Chanzelia has been mobilized in full to recreate a number of the weapons used in the war between man and dragon a millennium ago.
Thus I thought to grant you a tantalizing taste of our success. Hold your applause, please! ...I jest. Keep it coming! Eee hee hee hee!
And this is one of 'em, huh? What'd she call it—a ＂manacaster＂? Looks pretty, uh, antique.
Antique or no, it's a piece of engineering that far exceeds anything we know today. I'm certain it packs a punch.
I don't relish breaking technological taboo, but the battles ahead will only grow more fierce. I'll not turn away the help.
Chelle probably sent this to us for precisely that reason.
All I know is she's supposed to be sly as a fox. Guess I can add generous to that list.
Well... With her, it's never that simple.
I suspect she wants data concerning the manacaster and knew it would see field use soon enough here.
So we're her R&D team now? Fair enough. Gonna go out on a limb here and assume you're telling me all this for a reason.
Yes. I would entrust this weapon to you, Joe, if you would accept it.
I expect you have your reservations, but your insights as an expert marksman would be invaluable.
Well, shucks. Hard to say no after you've buttered me up so nicely.
But I'm a bowman. There's no guarantee I can get this thing to shoot straight.
I'm not worried. Please, give it a try.
Well-balanced... Nice heft. Can't put my trigger finger on why, but it feels...right.
You try holdin' this thing, Euden?
Only long enough to know it would suit you perfectly.
You ain't wrong. I felt it too, soon as I touched the thing.
This baby and I are gonna have a whooole lotta fun together. I can tell.
Well, I'm glad you like it.
Chelle's people were able to reconstruct that caster from the relic they unearthed, but they can't yet produce them at scale.
Some problem with reproducing the mana injection cylinder, apparently—
You're sayin' this is pretty unique, yeah? I'll be real careful not to lose or break it.
I'll come check in after you've had a chance to take it for a spin.
Copy that.
You've had a long nap, Mr. Manacaster... Ol' Joe's gonna show you a real good time.
You and I are partners in crime from here on out.
Today I graduate from bein' the Fire's Fletcher to the world's lone mana sharpshooter!
I've about got the hang of you now. Just...
How's it going?
Ah, Euden. Going pretty well, I'd say This thing has a lot to offer.
How's about a demo?
Meaning...?
Meaning you pick a tree, and I'll hit it. Any tree you like. Hell, pick a few.
All right. What about... Hmm, it's a bit far, but that one over there, and then the limb sticking out from that tree there.
Two targets... And that branch is pretty slim. Heh, you're not makin' this easy.
I'll give it a go.
Fire!
Bah. Mediocre at best. Least I hit the targets, though.
And so quickly! I only heard the sound of one shot between them.
Not only that, but you've hit both the targets I specified dead center. In what world is that ＂mediocre＂?
Any chump could do as much with enough training. But I'm not just any chump. Reckon I could get faster. More precise.
I sincerely doubt that anyone else could repeat a feat like that, Joe...
My old rival could. Hell, he'd hit 'em twice as quick.
I'm, er, drawing a blank on who that is.
Ain't we been over this? We fought a duel over which of us would get to challenge the world's best bowslinger.
Heh... But I digress. Maybe it was a tad gracious of me to say ANYONE could do it.
Still, I've never met a beast as easy to tame as this manacaster. Real intuitive.
Takes a fair bit of muscle to draw a bow. Takes a lot more to pierce a target on the horizon clean through.
And yet it wouldn't take you a tenth of the training to use a caster in battle.
Truly? A tenth?
Sure. All's you need is ready, aim, fire. No muscle necessary.
Plus, the mana it fires comes from bullets that have been charged by whoever else beforehand. Zero impact on the user.
All you need to do is pull the trigger, and BAM. Target eliminated. It's just...
Is something troubling you?
I still haven't quite wrapped my head around it. The caster's a hell of a weapon. I'm a fan. But something's gnawin' at me.
Hate to impose, Euden, but can I get a bit more time with it?
Be my guest. Sorting all this out is the point of testing in the first place.
Heh. 'Preciate it.
And now that THAT'S settled, how's about you help me with a little experiment?
Gladly. Need me to pick another tree?
Nah. I'll put an apple on my head and you can shoot it off.
I'M the one doing the shooting now?!
Hah, I'm just pullin' your leg. Hard to laugh with a ventilated skull, though, so let's put the kibosh on that experiment for now.
...Soon as I touched this thing, I could tell it had the potential to bring me new thrills...and I'm going to master it.
That oughta do it.
I reckon that's the last of the fiends 'round here.
Brilliant work. You're a bona fide manacaster master at this point!
Oh. Hey, Euden. All wrapped up on your end?
Indeed. We've exterminated all the fiends hassling the local villagers. Giving you that weapon was clearly the right call.
Have you managed to pin down what was troubling you before?
Sure have. And it's all thanks to you.
I stopped counting halfway through, but I shot down at least a hundred fiends with this thing. And it's not doin' it for me.
Er, it's not doing...what for you?
It's too easy. There's no thrill in taking something down with a manacaster. No satisfaction. No sense of accomplishment.
Well, I...suppose that's an understandable sticking point for someone like you, Joe.
That ain't it, Euden. I'm not complainin' for my own sake here.
I'm sayin' it spells trouble for people who aren't used to fighting at all.
How so?
I told you before that the caster's easier to pick up than other weapons, yeah?
You did indeed.
Unlike conventional weapons, a caster doesn't need brawn to wield. Or training.
In other words, you slap a caster in their hands and any Tom, Dick, or Harry could hit the battlefield.
But like I said, it's an empty strength. You can dole out death without so much as breakin' a sweat.
And removin' that weight from the equation means you stop feelin' fear.
...Ah. I'm beginning to see your point.
War should be scary. It NEEDS to be.
I worry that if everybody gets a caster, we'll lose that very necessary anxiety.
And that's the lingering doubt you felt.
Combat makes your pulse pound because both sides know the stakes and they're scared as hell of dying.
The caster's a powerful weapon, all right, but that power leads to complacency. Numbs the senses. Frankly, it's soulless.
And combat with no soul's just meaningless, empty slaughter.
Joe...
Hah, I must be losin' my touch.  All that exciting potential I felt when I first held this thing, and in the end, it's all hollow.
You can have it back. Tell your sister what I said, would ya?
I will. I'll send it off to Chelle with a courier later today.
With a letter detailing your concerns, of course.
'Preciate it, Euden.
The ＂manacaster,＂ huh? Yes... This will do nicely.
Joe! I need you!
Well, shucks, Euden. I'm guessin' it's serious?
The convoy carrying the manacaster was waylaid. The carriage driver is safe, thankfully...
But the caster's gone. I get you. I'll help track down whoever took it.
I appreciate it. I'll make for Chanzelia to inform my sister of what's happened.
I would ask you to track the thief. And let me give you this spare caster Chelle sent, just in case.
I'd rather put my caster days behind me, but I suppose now ain't the time to be picky.
Any idea where our rat might be hiding?
The convoy was ambushed just south of the Egan Flats, so—
Found you. Now, how's about you hand over the caster before things get ugly?
Wait. Miguel?! But you're... That's not possible!
No, it isn't. Because Miguel is dead, Joe, at your filthy hands. You killed my little brother!
Your brother?! Then you're—
Ramon. Miguel was the only blood I had, and you killed him in a ridiculous duel for the right to challenge that bowmaster.
Funny. He never mentioned a brother. Least of all an identical one.
Hmph. I'm not surprised. He always had a chip on his shoulder as the younger twin.
So now you've come to get revenge.
I'm fresh out of flowers for his grave, you see. Figured he'd prefer your head anyway!
Rgh, he's quick!
*Tsk* He actually grazed me.
What's wrong? You forget how to pull the trigger, or are you planning to just stand there and accept your fate?
Well, I won't keep you waiting. The next bullet's going straight through your heart!
Not on my watch!
Gah! The coward brought friends!
Euden?! When'd you get here?
I set out after you straight from Chanzelia. But forget that, Joe. Use the caster!
I know you said it was a soulless weapon, but I think there's more to it than that.
Oh?
You just didn't have the right opponent— someone to put that fear you were missing into your heart.
But now, each of you holds the same caster, and the same threat of death hangs over your heads. Do you feel it?
Heh. Damn right I do. My blood's pumpin' red-hot through my veins.
This duel will tell me all I need to know about the caster's worth as a weapon!
Then I'll stay out of your way.
Just don't blink, or you'll miss the show.
I won't. I leave it to you, Joe.
Sorry to keep you. Let's finish this. Quick draw contest suit your fancy?
Suits me fine. Bow or caster, there's no one quicker than me.
Not even Miguel?
Who do you think taught him? He was a genius with the bow, no question. But he lacked consistency.
We were an even match, the two of us. I knew that once he found his form, he'd go on to surpass me and be the world's best!
If he was in peak condition, he'd never have lost to the likes of you. I'll prove that when I kill you, here and now.
Fair enough. I can tell from your opening volley you're a crack shot to rival Miguel.
But are you good enough to kill ME? Reckon you're about to find out.
In a hurry to die, are we? Fine by me. ...We draw when the bird on that outcrop takes off. Agreed?
As you like. I'm ready whenever.
Those your last words?
(Got him! I knew I was the fastes—?!)
NRAAAUGH! My aaarm!
Heh. Looks like I'm the quicker draw.
How?! I reacted before you—I'm sure of it!
Don't quite know what to tell you, brother. Proof's in the puddin'. I'm just better.
Guess if I had to say why, it'd be... because I put my soul into it.
I've lost. Kill me and get it over with.
Pass. See, I don't much cotton to taking orders.
Sure you can afford to let me go? As long as I draw breath, I'll keep coming for you!
Sign me up. I'll roll out the welcome mat. But next time, make it interesting. Can't shoot straight when you're drunk on hate.
Revenge is a dish best served cold. Go cool off and we can try this again.
Hey, Joe!
There you are. I've been looking for you.
Lemme guess: Another waylaid convoy?
Hah, no. That's not a mistake I'll soon repeat. I'm here on another matter.
In all the commotion before, I didn't get to give you Chelle's reply to your concerns.
You made the trip here just for that? Now that's dedication.
So? What's the good lady have to say?
Surprising no one, she was apparently already aware of every issue you raised.
She said she'd never have given a caster to someone who didn't already know the fear of battle.
I guess I should be flattered.
Honestly, I think it's less a matter of trust and more that she figured she'd come out on top no matter what happened.
She's the sort of gal who turned a near- theft into an opportunity to get new combat data, so...I'm not surprised.
Well, she's also the ＂sort of gal＂ who sent you a present.
...Okay, NOW I'm surprised.
Her way of thanking you for putting her prototype through its paces, she said. ...Here.
This is no prototype. It's a perfected model, re-tuned to reflect your feedback— your very own manacaster, Joe.
Say, Euden...
Before, I said that the manacaster was an empty weapon.
I remember.
Well, I was wrong. A caster's as valid a weapon as any. You just have to dig a little deeper to find its true worth.
I felt it in that duel I fought— in every throb of my poundin' heart.
I put my soul into my weapon. He didn't. That was the gulf that divided us.
You mean to say he was less skilled?
He was less everything: less skilled, less determined, and with less to lose. In short, his soul wasn't in it.
In terms of raw finesse, there ain't much daylight between Ramon and me. But soul-wise? It's no contest. Night and day.
It may not take much practice to get good with a caster, but I ain't scared of anyone who wields one half-cocked.
And it made me realize that a manacaster can give me the thrills I seek, so long as I pour my soul into it.
Then you'll accept it?
Gratefully, even. This baby's my new partner!
Heh. Watch out, fiends. As of today, I'm the Scorching Sharpshooter!
